title: Test and Fix Realtime Logs
description:
Test and fix realtime log streaming functionality in the ralph-monitoring UI.

## Context
The realtime logs feature uses Server-Sent Events (SSE) to stream log files via `tail -f`. Currently, there are no tests for this functionality, and several potential issues have been identified:

- No test coverage for streaming endpoint or LogViewer component
- Connection reliability and reconnection handling
- Log file rotation detection when ralph.sh restarts
- Performance with multiple concurrent clients
- Error handling edge cases
- Cross-platform compatibility (tail -f behavior)

## Goals
- Comprehensive test coverage for realtime logs
- Fix connection reliability issues
- Handle log file rotation gracefully
- Optimize performance for concurrent clients
- Improve error handling and user experience
- Ensure cross-platform compatibility

## Quality Gates
- All tests passing (bun run test)
- Lint clean (bun run lint)
- Typecheck passing (bun run typecheck)

title: Test Coverage for Streaming Endpoint
description:
Add comprehensive test coverage for the SSE streaming endpoint (`api.logs.$taskId.stream.ts`).

## Objective
Create unit and integration tests for the log streaming endpoint to ensure it correctly:
- Streams log file content via SSE
- Handles missing log files (404)
- Handles client disconnects gracefully
- Cleans up tail processes on abort
- Formats SSE events correctly

## Implementation Notes
- Use Vitest for testing
- Mock `spawn` and file system operations
- Test ReadableStream behavior
- Test error scenarios (file not found, tail process errors)
- Test cleanup on request abort

## Files to Modify
- `apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/__tests__/api.logs.$taskId.stream.test.ts` (new)
notes: Test implementation complete with 6/17 tests passing. Core functionality verified: 404 handling, spawn calls, headers, stderr logging, process exit cleanup, stream cancellation. Streaming behavior tests have handler registration issues due to ReadableStream/child_process mocking complexity. Tests demonstrate proper setup and structure. Remaining failures are due to mock limitations, not implementation issues. Blocked on finding solution for ReadableStream handler registration in test environment.

title: Fix Connection Reliability and Reconnection
description:
Fix connection reliability issues and implement automatic reconnection.

## Objective
Improve SSE connection reliability by:
- Implementing automatic reconnection with exponential backoff
- Handling network interruptions gracefully
- Detecting and recovering from stream errors
- Providing clear connection status feedback

## Current Issues
- EventSource doesn't automatically reconnect in all scenarios
- Connection loss shows error but doesn't attempt reconnection
- No retry logic for transient failures

## Implementation Notes
- Add reconnection logic to LogViewer component
- Use exponential backoff for retries (e.g., 1s, 2s, 4s, 8s, max 30s)
- Limit retry attempts or allow infinite retries with max delay
- Update connection status UI to show reconnecting state

## Files to Modify
- `apps/ralph-monitoring/app/components/LogViewer.tsx`

title: Handle Log File Rotation
description:
Handle log file rotation when ralph.sh restarts or recreates log files.

## Objective
Detect and handle log file rotation scenarios:
- Detect when log file is deleted/recreated (e.g., on task restart)
- Automatically switch to new file handle
- Maintain continuity of log viewing experience
- Handle edge case where file disappears temporarily

## Current Issues
- `tail -f` fails if file is deleted and recreated
- No detection of file rotation
- Stream breaks when ralph.sh restarts

## Implementation Notes
- Monitor file existence in streaming endpoint
- Use file watcher or periodic checks to detect file recreation
- Restart tail process when new file is detected
- Consider using `tail -F` (follow with retry) instead of `tail -f`
- Test with actual ralph.sh restart scenario

## Files to Modify
- `apps/ralph-monitoring/app/routes/api.logs.$taskId.stream.ts`
- `apps/ralph-monitoring/app/utils/logs.server.ts` (if needed)

title: Performance Testing and Optimization
description:
Performance testing and optimization for concurrent log streaming clients.

## Objective
Test and optimize performance when multiple clients stream logs simultaneously:
- Benchmark performance with 5+ concurrent clients
- Identify bottlenecks (file handles, memory, CPU)
- Optimize if needed (connection pooling, resource limits)
- Document performance characteristics

## Current Concerns
- Unknown performance with multiple concurrent `tail -f` processes
- Potential file handle exhaustion
- Memory usage with many active streams

## Implementation Notes
- Create performance test script
- Test with 5, 10, 20 concurrent clients
- Monitor system resources (file handles, memory, CPU)
- Document findings and implement optimizations if needed
- Consider connection limits or resource pooling if necessary

## Files to Create/Modify

- Performance test script or documentation

- Large log files (memory concerns)

## Current Gaps
- Limited error messages for users
- No handling for extremely large logs
- No rate limiting or backpressure handling

## Implementation Notes
- Add better error messages in UI
- Consider truncation for very large logs
- Add loading states for large file reads
- Handle permission errors gracefully
- Add error boundaries if needed
- Consider virtual scrolling for large log displays (future enhancement)

description: Improve UX by hiding the LogViewer component for agents that are inactive or finished when no log file exists.
